meta.name: google-site-verification

form.name: form1

div.span: Tri-Village Local Schools will continue remote learning for the remainder of the school year. More details will follow, please stay tuned.

span.strong: Third quarter report cards for students were mailed home, April 17th, 2020.
There is a distance learning survey located on the right side of the school website.
When you have an opportunity, please take a moment to complete the survey so we can continue to adjust our opportunities for our students during this time.

strong.span: Junior high and high school will have parent teacher conferences via google meets on Tuesday, April 28

span.strong: Junior high and high school teachers will be available for questions on their google meets link, and follow up telephone calls will also be available.
Elementary parents, teachers will be in contact for parent communication via google meets, email, phone, text, or classroom dojo.

div.span: Students/Parents you can reach your student's teachers between the hours of 8:00 am - 2:45 pm. Please reach out via email or their teacher remote link.

em.span: *On Fridays teacher will post individual “office hours” in their google classroom

span.strong: Students/Parents you can reach your student's teachers between the hours of 8:00 am - 2:45 pm. Please reach out via email or their teacher remote link.

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;color:#ff0000;font-size:16px

strong.span: Starting today (3/23/2020) the Meals on Wheels program will now

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;color:#ff0000;font-size:16px;text-decoration:underline
font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;color:#ff0000;font-size:16px

strong.span: deliver on Mondays and Wednesdays. The drop off times and places will remain the same. Meals will continue to be delivered until further notice.

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;color:#ff0000;font-size:16px

strong.span: You will now receive lunches for Monday and Tuesday on Mondays.

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;color:#ff0000;font-size:16px

strong.span: Lunches for Wednesday, Thursday and Friday will be delivered on Wednesdays.

span.style: font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-weight: 400; text-align: start; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;font-size:16px;color:#000080

em.span: Please contact the school if you should have any questions!

p.span: At Tri-Village Local Schools, the health, safety and well being of students and staff are top priorities. In recent weeks, we have seen a rapidly evolving situation with the coronavirus (COVID-19) throughout the world and United States. With the disease making headlines, district officials want to make sure to reinforce preventative safety measures and to provide an update on how we are monitoring the situation.

span.style: font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; font-size: 14pt; text-align: center

p.span: Tri Village Elementary School is currently registering kindergarten students for the 2020-2021 school year. Registration packets are available at the office Monday/Wednesday/Friday from 8:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M.

span.style: font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; font-size: 14pt; text-align: center
font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; font-size: 14pt; text-align: center

p.span: If you cannot come during this time frame, please call the elementary office as soon as possible so that we can make arrangements for you to receive the necessary information.

span.style: font-family: "Century Gothic", sans-serif; font-size: 14pt; text-align: center

p.span: Children being registered for Kindergarten must be 5 years of age by August 1, 2020 in order to be eligible for enrollment. Parents should bring the child’s birth certificate (must be original), custody papers (if that applies) and immunization record. Please plan on spending a few minutes completing the necessary registration paperwork.
If you have any questions, please contact our office at 937-996-1511 (Option 2) and ask for Angie Harrington, Elementary Secretary.

div.span: Tri-Village Students designate Week of March 30 for Majority Drug-Free Prevention and Education Awareness Week

span.span: TRI-VILLAGE — Did you know that statistically, a MAJORITY of students abstain from drugs, alcohol, and tobacco and are paving the way to a bright future?

p.span: Students at Tri-Village involved in the We are the Majority Peer-Led Program recently met with Mayor Monyca Schlechty to sign a document to proclaim the week of March 30 as Majority Awareness Drug-Free Prevention Education Week. The teens would like their peers and the community to know that there are students concerned about drug prevention and mental health promotion. Leaders hope for proactive community support surrounding these particular topics. WATM students also would like to share with the public that a majority of teens say no to dangerous decisions and understand the harmful implications that arise from use.

em.span: The Tri-Village We are the Majority Peer-Led Program recently met with Mayor Monyca Schlechty to sign a document to proclaim the week of March 30 as Majority Awareness Drug-Free Prevention Education Week.

span.strong: Congratulations to the following Science Fair Participants.

div.b: The following students received Superior and will be competing in the District Competition on March 14h at Edison Community College:
The following special awards were won:

div.div: Ashdon Dyson: Outstanding Project Award in Chemistry/Biochemistry 2nd Place
Robin Hayes/Amariah Markley: Outstanding Project Award in Behavioral and Social Science 2nd Place

Cora Gutierrez: Outstanding Project Award in Plant Science 1st Place; Boonshoft Museum of Discovery Family Membership; Cargill Award for Overall Best Presentation of Data; Menke Family Award in Plant Science 1st Place

br.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: School Supplies Donated by Greenville Elks

span.span: Thank you to the Greenville Elk's donated a substantial amount of school supplies to the elementary and high school to help get students through the rest of the school year. Several of their volunteers have visited us the last couple of years, dropping off numerous supplies!

strong.span: Congratulations to Mrs. Jonna Raffel, Language Arts teacher, who was selected “Teacher of the Year” by her peers in the Tri-Village Local School District.

div.span: Children being registered for Kindergarten must be 5 years of age by August 1, 2020 in order to be eligible for enrollment. Parents should bring the child’s birth certificate (must be original), custody papers (if that applies) and immunization record at a later date and time to be determinted.

br.style: color: #202124; font-family: Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: We will also need a copy of your birth certificate and custody paperwork (if applicable).

div.span: Parents and Staff: You can refer students for all four types of acceleration - early entrance, subject level, grade level and early graduation. Click on the file to access the form.

span.em: It is the mission of the Tri-Village Local School District to provide learners with the best possible opportunities to learn and to grow intellectually and socially, to instill a desire for knowledge and an appreciation for excellence that will, through appropriate use of current and future technologies, teaching methods, and learning styles, prepare them for the future.
